books.title: Passages from the Life of a Philosopher
books.author: Charles Babbage
books.summary: The eminent Victorian scientist and mathematician on his inventions, dreams and adventures.

books.title: The Survivors of the Chancellor
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: A record of the ill-fated voyage of the Chancellor as told by one of the passengers.

books.title: Passages from the Life of a Philosopher
books.author: Charles Babbage
books.summary: The eminent Victorian scientist and mathematician on his inventions, dreams and adventures.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Bambi
books.author: Felix Salten
books.summary: A roe deer learns the rules of the forest and how to survive in a world inhabited by men as he grows to maturity.

books.title: Jurgen
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: Jurgen, a pawnbroker and “monstrous clever fellow,” is sent on a witty and parodic magical journey in search of true love.

books.title: R.U.R.
books.author: Karel Čapek
books.summary: The development of artificial beings in huge quantities to act as workers and soldiers leads to disaster for mankind.

books.title: Lady Into Fox
books.author: David Garnett
books.summary: A newly-married young woman is suddenly transformed into a fox, to the consternation and enduring grief of her husband.

books.title: The Fifth Queen
books.author: Ford Madox Ford
books.summary: A young noblewoman arrives at court and quickly gets embroiled in court politics and comes to the attention of the king.

books.title: Brood of the Witch-Queen
books.author: Sax Rohmer
books.summary: A father and son duo investigate a man who is wielding ancient Egyptian magic.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Uncle Silas
books.author: J. Sheridan Le Fanu
books.summary: An heiress becomes ward to her disreputable uncle with an unsavory past, tainted by the apparent suicide of a man to whom he owed a large gambling debt, and must help clear his name.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.

books.title: Moribund Society and Anarchy
books.author: Jean Grave
books.summary: Jean Grave systemically critiques bourgeois society from an anarchist perspective.

books.title: The Kalevala
books.author: Elias Lönnrot
books.summary: The Finnish national epic poem recounting the creation of the Earth and the adventures of its mythical heroes.

books.title: The Luck of Barry Lyndon
books.author: William Makepeace Thackeray
books.summary: A poor Irish rogue tries to win fame and fortune in the 18th-century English aristocracy.

books.title: The Jewels of Aptor
books.author: Samuel R. Delany
books.summary: Four companions travel to the mysterious island of Aptor in search of a jewel.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of P. G. Wodehouse’s short fiction.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: The Path to Rome
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a walking pilgrimage to Rome from his hometown in France, writing of the journey, sketching the sights, and digressing on a wide variety of subjects.
